segments.text: I notice the boy on the stool, stretching to reach the cookie jar.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: He’s balancing so precariously, and the stool looks like it’s about to tip over.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: His little sister is watching him, waiting for a cookie, completely unaware of the danger.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t help but feel anxious just looking at him.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The stool is already wobbling, and he’s not even holding on to anything.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope he doesn’t fall and hurt himself.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman drying dishes has no idea what’s going on behind her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She’s so focused on her task that she doesn’t see the kids or the water.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s like she’s in another world, and the children are taking advantage of it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wish someone would step in and stop this before it’s too late.
segments.speaker: PAR
